content.raw:
At first I thought this was a good idea, but now I don't think it is. The primary problem is that SDF will now be two different formats. Anyone parsing SDF will have to write code that handles both SDF and URDF. At a minimum we'd have to change all the code in Gazebo to check for the existence of either URDF or SDF. All other users of libsdformat will have to do the same. 

I think we should stick with the notion of anything going into libsdformat will come out as pure SDF.

We can implement a SDF->URDF converter, which may help some people.
